meanings.definition: A duplicate printing plate made by electrolytic deposition.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed an electrotype of the ancient coin.
meanings.sent2: The printer used an electrotype to create multiple copies of the design.
meanings.sent3: The artist joked that the electrotype of the painting was so good, it could fool even experts.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an electrotype, perfectly replicated in every photograph.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering electrotype gleamed under the gallery lights, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To make a duplicate printing plate using electrolytic deposition.
meanings.sent1: The technician will electrotype the image onto the new plate.
meanings.sent2: Artists often electrotype their sketches to preserve the original artwork.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally electrotyped the wrong image, creating a humorous mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His words electrotype themselves in my mind, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The process of electrotyping requires precision and patience to achieve accurate results.
